clinical_validity.disease_label: congenital anomaly of kidney and urinary tract

generif.text: ALC1 is the target oncogene within the chromosome 1q21 amplicon and plays a pivotal role in hepeatocellular carcinoma pathogenesis.

results define ALC1 as a DNA damage-response protein whose role in this process is sustained by its association with known DNA repair factors and its rapid poly(ADP-ribose)-dependent recruitment to DNA damage sites

Alc1 is a chromatin remodeling enzyme activated by binding of its macrodomain to poly(ADP-ribosyl)ated Parp1. Alc1 is recruited to nucleosomes in vitro and to chromatin in cells when Parp1 catalyzes poly(ADP-ribose) synthesis at sites of DNA damage.
Poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation directs recruitment and activation of the ATP-dependent chromatin remodeler ALC1
CHD1L promotes hepatocellular carcinoma progression and metastasis in mice and is associated with these processes in human patients.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Overexpression of CHD1L was significantly associated with tumour microsatellite formation, advanced tumour stage, overall survival time of patients who received transarterial chemoembolisation treatment and chemoresistance in hepatocellular carcinoma.
1q21.1 copy number variant (CNV) results in newly identified function such as decatenation (chromatid untangling) checkpoint (DCC) activation in the case of CHD1l/ALC1 in lymphoblast cell lines.
CHD1L/TCTP/Cdc25C/Cdk1 molecular pathway causes the malignant transformation of hepatocytes with the phenotypes of accelerated mitotic progression and the production of aneuploidy
Mutation in CHD1L is associated with congenital anomalies of the kidneys and urinary tract.

positive expression of CHD1L protein is significantly correlated with the metastasis proceeding of ovarian carcinoma, and CHD1L protein expression, as examined by IHC, may act as a novel prognostic biomarker for patients with ovarian carcinoma.

data support a model in which poly(ADP-ribosyl)ation of DDB2 suppresses DDB2 ubiquitylation and outline a molecular mechanism for PARP1-mediated regulation of nucleotide excision repair through DDB2 stabilization and recruitment of the chromatin remodeler ALC1
the model that PAR present on PARylated PARP1 acts as an allosteric effector of ALC1 nucleosome remodeling activity.
CHD1L is the target oncogene within the 1q21 amplicon and plays a pivotal role in colorectal carcinoma pathogenesis.
Data indicate that chromodomain helicase/ATPase DNA-binding protein 1-like (CHD1L) might be an diagnostic and prognostic marker for bladder cancer (BC) patients.
TRIM33 plays a role in PARP-dependent DNA damage response and regulates ALC1 activity by promoting its timely removal from sites of DNA damage.
These results indicated that CHD1L could serve as a prognostic marker for gastric cancer
CHD1L is now considered to be a novel independent biomarker for progression, prognosis and survival in several solid tumors. [Review]
Relative mRNA expression level of CHD1L was higher in breast cancer cell lines.
CHD1L is involved in the progression of glioma.
Overexpression of CHD1L is positively associated with tumor metastasis of lung adenocarcinoma, and might serve as a novel prognostic biomarker and potential therapeutic target for patients.
This study identified CHD1L as a potential anti-metastasis target for therapeutic intervention in breast cancer.

CHD1L exerts its anti-apoptotic role through the apoptotic pathway involving caspase-9-caspase-3 apoptotic pathway in MM cells. In addition, we determined that CHD1L expression is increased when MM cells were adhered to fibronectin (FN) or bone marrow stromal cells
overexpression of CHD1L in embryonic cells upregulated the expression of ectoderm genes, especially PAX6
ALC1 is a unique base excision repair factor that functions in a chromatin context, most likely as a chromatin-remodeling enzyme.

Upon DNA damage, binding of PARylated PARP1 by the macro domain induces a conformational change that relieves autoinhibitory interactions with the ATPase motor, which selectively activates ALC1 remodeling upon recruitment to sites of DNA damage.
NAD(+)-metabolite and nucleic acid poly-ADP-ribose triggers ALC1 to drive chromatin relaxation. Modular allostery in this oncogene tightly controls its robust, DNA-damage-dependent activation.
implies a previously unappreciated role for ALC1 in DNA replication, in which ALC1 may regulate replication-fork slowing at CPT-induced DNA-damage sites
CHD1L overexpression was associated with poor prognosis and advanced clinicopathological features, CHD1L may be a valuable biomarker for prognostication of cancer patients.
The data demonstrate that CHD1L could induce cisplatin resistance in non-small-cell lung cancer via c-Jun-ABCB1-NF-kappaB axis.
High CHD1L expression is associated with proliferation and metastasis of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.

Results show that ALC1 facilitates DNA end resection and homologous recombination and, as a consequence, impairs NHEJ. This role is exerted by controlling CtIP expression and relies on the presence of a G4 structure in the 5'-UTR of the CtIP major mRNA isoform.
First-in-Class Inhibitors of Oncogenic CHD1L with Preclinical Activity against Colorectal Cancer.
CHD1L promotes EOC cell invasiveness and metastasis via the regulation of METAP2.
The Oncogenic Helicase ALC1 Regulates PARP Inhibitor Potency by Trapping PARP2 at DNA Breaks.
The chromatin remodeler ALC1 underlies resistance to PARP inhibitor treatment.
Mechanistic Insights into Regulation of the ALC1 Remodeler by the Nucleosome Acidic Patch.
ALC1 links chromatin accessibility to PARP inhibitor response in homologous recombination-deficient cells.
Effect of chromodomain helicase/ATPase DNA binding protein 1-like gene on the invasion and metastasis of tongue squamous cell carcinoma CAL27 cells.
The high expression of CHD1L and its clinical significance in human solid tumors: A meta-analysis.
Suppressing CHD1L reduces the proliferation and chemoresistance in osteosarcoma.
Structural basis of ALC1/CHD1L autoinhibition and the mechanism of activation by the nucleosome.
Genome-wide scanning for CHD1L gene in papillary thyroid carcinoma complicated with type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Multiple roles for PARP1 in ALC1-dependent nucleosome remodeling.
Structure and dynamics of the chromatin remodeler ALC1 bound to a PARylated nucleosome.
CHD1L prevents lipopolysaccharide-induced hepatocellular carcinomar cell death by activating hnRNP A2/B1-nmMYLK axis.
CHD1L augments autophagy-mediated migration of hepatocellular carcinoma through targeting ZKSCAN3.
Serine ADP-ribosylation marks nucleosomes for ALC1-dependent chromatin remodeling.
Chromodomain Helicase DNA Binding Protein 1-like, a negative regulator of Forkhead box O3a, promotes the proliferation and migration of Angiotensin II-induced vascular smooth muscle cells.
Host genetic variation at a locus near CHD1L impacts HIV sequence diversity in a South African population.

interpro.desc: DNA/RNA helicase, ATP-dependent, DEAH-box type, conserved site

name: chromodomain helicase DNA binding protein 1 like

reactome.name: Formation of Incision Complex in GG-NER

summary: This gene encodes a DNA helicase protein involved in DNA repair. The protein converts ATP to add poly(ADP-ribose) as it regulates chromatin relaxation following DNA damage. Overexpression of this gene has been linked to several types of cancers. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2017].
